That thought brings me to the nature of animals themselves, and to ’che remedies for all diseases, of even greater reliability, that are implanted in them at birth. For again, the Mother of all creation both willed that no animal should be born merely to eat or to satisfy the appetites of others, implanting also healthful medicines in their vitals, be- cause she was implanting them even in unconseious things, and she also willed that those outstanding aids to life should come from another life, a thought be- yond all else most wonderful.
